column1: #Text=Start a Primary School Media and School Newspaper
#Text=Are you keen on running your own mini-media empire at an early age in school ?
#Text=This can be a fantastic grounding for a future career and gives you a very early opportunity to learn about managing people , deadlines , and expectations .
#Text=This article provides a brief overview of the things to consider when developing your publishing company .
#Text=Build your team of at least 4 " staff " .
#Text=You will likely have to double up on a number of the tasks and have each person responsible for several jobs .
#Text=You will also need to consider the need for a :
#Text=In addition to your staff you may need a board of directors , consisting of :

#Text=A President , Vice President , Treasurer , Secretary , and representatives from all 4 classes , the board of directors President , VP , Treasurer and Secretary should be appointed by the representatives , and the representatives should be appointed be the class officers .
#Text=Give your newspapers(s) a cutting edge name .
#Text=Brainstorm with your team for a suitable name .
#Text=Decide how many pages you will have and what will be the contents .
#Text=Use a page layout and word processing program to build your paper .
#Text=Cut down on ink and paper ; try to get your school to print it .
#Text=Decide a price , it can be free if you have ads in it or sponsors .
#Text=Your team will need to go around and rally sponsors and funds for it if you do not sell it .
#Text=Even if you have sponsorship , you might need to sell it to cover overheads and to give the paper value in people 's minds .
#Text=People often dismiss that which is freely given .
#Text=Be a motivator and sell the virtues of being a part of the newspaper team for their future careers , their sense of community involvement and their love of helping others and writing .
#Text=Be careful not to overdo it though and use people up .
#Text=Everyone deserves a fair go and nobody should be left feeling that they have been used up when they are volunteering their time , efforts , and ideas .
#Text=Recognize their efforts and reward them in appropriate ways as possible .
#Text=Write your articles in a word-processor first .
#Text=Suggestions include OpenOffice.org Writer , Corel WordPerfect , AbiWord , Apple Pages and Microsoft Word .
#Text=The industry standard is QuarkXPress and Adobe InDesign , but for a free alternative , try Scribus .
#Text=If you already paid for Microsoft Office , there is Publisher in some ( but not all ) editions .
